moves.4. e3 g6: Wanting to play Bg7 and then castle.
moves.7... a6: Should be opening up the bishop by d6 or d5.
moves.8. a3 d6: Opens up the bishop, this move usually blocks in the black squared bishop, but because the bishop is at g7, this move is fine.
moves.10. e4: Blocks the threat and threteans the bishop.
moves.10... Bg4 11. d5 Nd4: Threatening the queen and bishop unless the swap is excepted.
moves.12. Nxd4: The swap is excepted, and I surely like my position.
moves.14. bxc3: Blunder. I get a bishop for a pawn.
moves.17. Rfe1 h6: I threaten the bishop, wanting it to get out of my territory.
moves.18. Be3 Qxe4 19. Qd2: Bad move, I receive a free pawn.
moves.22. Qc2 Rfe8 23. Red1: Doesn't take the rook, and now my bishop is pinned to my queen.
moves.25. Bd2 Qd4: Now I like my position, threatening mate in two.
moves.26. Rxc3 Nxc3: Bad move, I could have got checkmate in two moves.
